intro: Stemodia hirsuta, commonly known as hairy stemodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
